pageContext.claim: “The Kurds fought with us, but were paid massive amounts of money and equipment to do so. They have been fighting Turkey for decades. I held off this fight for almost 3 years, but it is time for us to get out of these ridiculous Endless Wars, many of them tribal, and bring our soldiers home.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. has provided some equipment and weapons to Kurdish forces and paid monthly stipends ranging from $100 to $400 per soldier, totaling $48 million in fiscal year 2019. The assistance included 3,000 AK-47 rifles (total cost: $2.4 million), ammunition, hand grenades, explosives, bulldozers, and non-tactical vehicles (total cost: $86 million). For a successful military operation, this was peanuts in a $700 billion military budget.
